Subsection.Text: The holder of a foreign product use certificate must keep records that contain all of the following information in respect of each foreign product that they import and use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the foreign product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method of empty container disposal;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method of disposal of any unused foreign product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: proof of purchase of the foreign product and the name of the foreign source from which it was purchased;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who transported the foreign product into Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date of importation.

Subsection.Text: The records must be kept for five years after the end of the year in which the foreign product use certificate that relates to the product expires or ceases to be valid.
The records must be made available to the Minister on request.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application of subsection 6(1) of the Act
Section.Text: Subsection 6(1) of the Act does not apply to the manufacture of a pest control product that is for use only in conducting research under these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Application of certain provisions to research
Section.Text: Sections 48 to 50 and 56 to 68 apply to an authorization under subsection 41(1) of the Act to use an unregistered pest control product for the purpose of research.
A person who seeks permission for a research establishment to conduct research must apply to the Minister to obtain a research authorization.
An application for a research authorization must include the information specified in subsections 6(1) and (3) in addition to all of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an electronic copy of the proposed experimental label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the research plan; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other information described in section 8 that the Minister may require to evaluate the health and environmental risks posed by the proposed research.

Subsection.Text: Before the Minister authorizes the use of a pest control product under subsection 41(1) of the Act for the purpose of research, the Minister must consider the health and environmental risks and determine that the proposed experimental label meets the requirements of section 60.

When the Minister authorizes the use of a pest control product to conduct research, the Minister must issue a research authorization certificate to the research establishment that sets out the conditions specified under subsection 41(1) of the Act, including those that relate to the experimental label.

Section.Text: A research establishment is exempt from the application of subsection 6(1) of the Act and section 48 if the Minister confirms under section 54 that the proposed research meets all of the criteria set out in section 53.

A research establishment that wishes to obtain confirmation under section 54 must notify the Minister by providing the information specified in subsections 6(1) and (3) in addition to both of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an electronic copy of the proposed experimental label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the research plan.

Section.Text: The following are the criteria referred to in section 51:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the research does not involve the use of a semiochemical;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a chemical pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of an antimicrobial agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve aerial application,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the application of a pest control product to water or to a place where runoff water may remove residues from the research site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product in any of the following areas:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: greenhouses,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: residential areas, including lawns, gardens and parks,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: industrial premises, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: food-handling areas,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product for either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: structural pest control, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fumigation,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product that contains a formulant that is on Part I of the List of Pest Control Product Formulants and Contaminants of Health or Environmental Concern or a contaminant that is on Part 3 of that List,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains an unregistered active ingredient, the application of the product is carried out only by a researcher

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: on 5 to 50 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: on 1 to 5 ha of land owned or operated by a cooperator, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains a registered active ingredient,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the application of the pest control product is carried out by a researcher or cooperator on 10 to 50 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment or a cooperator, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: there is a reasonable expectation that the research will not increase occupational exposure above the level that is expected when the pest control product is used in accordance with its conditions of registration; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a microbial agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve aerial application,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product that contains a formulant that is on Part 1 of the List of Pest Control Product Formulants and Contaminants of Health or Environmental Concern or a contaminant that is on Part 3 of that List,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the micro-organism is indigenous to the area where it is intended to be used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the application of the pest control product is carried out on a maximum of 10 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment or, in the case of an aquatic application, on a body of water that has a maximum of 1 ha of surface area and that is wholly contained on land owned or operated by a research establishment.

Section.Text: If the Minister confirms that the proposed research meets the criteria set out in section 53 and the proposed experimental label meets the requirements of section 60, the Minister must issue a research notification certificate to the research establishment.

Subsection.Text: A research establishment is exempt from the application of subsection 6(1) of the Act and sections 48, 52 and 59 to 63 if the research is conducted solely in a laboratory.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exemption and criteria — research not solely in laboratory
Subsection.Text: A research establishment is exempt from the application of subsection 6(1) of the Act and sections 48 and 52 if all or part of the research is conducted outside a laboratory and meets all of the following criteria:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a microbial agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a chemical pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of an antimicrobial agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve aerial application,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the application of a pest control product to water or to a place where runoff water may remove residues from the research site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product in any of the following areas:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: greenhouses,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: residential areas, including lawns, gardens and parks,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: industrial premises, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: food-handling areas,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product for either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: structural pest control, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fumigation,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product that contains a formulant that is on Part 1 of the List of Pest Control Product Formulants and Contaminants of Health or Environmental Concern or a contaminant that is on Part 3 of that List,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains an unregistered active ingredient, the application of the product is carried out only by a researcher

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: on a maximum of 5 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of land owned or operated by a cooperator, on a maximum of 1 ha or 5% of the total area of the crop under research, whichever is less, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains a registered active ingredient,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the application of the product is carried out by a researcher or cooperator on a maximum of 10 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment or a cooperator, or on a maximum of 20% of the total area of the crop under research, whichever is less, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: there is a reasonable expectation that the research will not increase occupational exposure above the level that is expected when the pest control product is used in accordance with its conditions of registration; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a semiochemical,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve aerial application,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the application of a pest control product to water,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product in any of the following areas:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: greenhouses,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: residential areas, including lawns, gardens and parks,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: industrial premises, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: food-handling areas,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product for either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: structural pest control, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fumigation,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not involve the use of a pest control product that contains a formulant that is on Part 1 of the List of Pest Control Product Formulants and Contaminants of Health or Environmental Concern or a contaminant that is on Part 3 of that List,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains an unregistered active ingredient, other than an arthropod pheromone, the application of the product is carried out only by a researcher on a maximum of 5 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains a registered active ingredient, other than an arthropod pheromone, the application of the product is carried out by a researcher or cooperator on a maximum of 10 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment or cooperator, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pest control product that contains an active ingredient that is an arthropod pheromone,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the application of the product is carried out on a maximum of 100 ha of land owned or operated by a research establishment or cooperator and the maximum use rate does not exceed 375 g of active ingredient per hectare per year, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if used in a food or feed crop, the pheromone is contained in an affixed solid matrix dispenser or in a retrievable-sized polymeric matrix dispenser, and the dispenser is not in direct contact with the crop.

Section.Text: A research authorization certificate and a research notification certificate expire on December 31 of the year in which they are issued, unless another expiry date is specified in the certificate.
Neither a research authorization certificate nor a research notification certificate is renewable.
Neither a research authorization certificate nor a research notification certificate is transferable.
Unless otherwise specified as a condition by the Minister under subsection 41(1) of the Act, a research establishment must post signs at every research site that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: show all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the following primary message, in both English and French:

Provision.Text: “PEST CONTROL EXPERIMENTAL SITE / SITE D’EXPÉRIMENTATION DE LUTTE ANTIPARASITAIRE
DO NOT ENTER WITHOUT AUTHORIZATION. / ACCÈS INTERDIT SANS AUTORISATION
CONTACT (contact name) AT (phone number). / S’ADRESSER À (nom du responsable) AU (no de téléphone).”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the research authorization certificate number or research notification certificate number, when there is one;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are visible, legible, indelible and posted at every entrance to the research site on each side of the entrance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are posted before treatment begins and remain posted until any treated food or feed crop is harvested or as long as data are being collected; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may include the name of the pest control product that is the subject of the research and the name and logo of its manufacturer, if they are printed smaller than the primary message.

Subsection.Text: A research establishment must ensure that every pest control product that is used in research is accompanied by an experimental label.
An experimental label must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: show all of the information specified in section 26, except paragraphs 26(1)(d), (g), (i) and (k) and (2)(d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: show

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the following information on the principal display panel:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the statement “EXPERIMENTAL USE ONLY”,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the research authorization certificate number or the research notification certificate number, when there is one, as follows:

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: “RESEARCH AUTHORIZATION/NOTIFICATION NO. (assigned number) PEST CONTROL PRODUCTS ACT”, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the statement “SALE PROHIBITED. NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION TO ANY PERSON OTHER THAN A RESEARCHER OR COOPERATOR.”,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the statement “KEEP OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN”,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer’s name and address, and

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: when the research involves the use of a pest control product that contains a formulant that is on Part 2 of the List of Pest Control Product Formulants and Contaminants of Health or Environmental Concern, the statement “Warning: contains the allergen (name of allergen)”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on the secondary display panel, when the research involves the use of an unregistered pest control product, in the instructions on decontamination procedures and disposal referred to in paragraph 26(2)(b), the statement “Any unused product must be returned to the manufacturer.”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: on the secondary display panel, despite paragraph (a), the statement set out in subparagraph 26(2)(e)(ii) amended to read as follows: “Take the experimental label with you when seeking medical attention.”; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: represent the intended research as described in the research plan.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (2)(a), when the research involves the use of a registered pest control product, the following information need not be shown on the experimental label if that label is used in conjunction with the approved label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net quantity referred to in paragraph 26(1)(j);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: instructions on decontamination procedures and disposal referred to in paragraph 26(2)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information that identifies any significant risk to the environment, and instructions on procedures to reduce those risks, referred to in paragraph 26(2)(c); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the notice to users referred to in paragraph 26(2)(g).

Section.Text: A research establishment must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: supply to every researcher and cooperator involved in the research a copy of the experimental label, which must be the approved experimental label if a research authorization certificate or research notification certificate has been issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce a copy of the experimental label to the Minister on request.

Section.Text: A research establishment must maintain records that contain all of the following information for each research project, for five years after the end of the project:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of every pest control product used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the researchers and cooperators;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the locations of the research sites;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the application methods; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the test data generated.

Section.Text: A research establishment may import an unregistered pest control product for the purpose of conducting research if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product is imported in accordance with section 36; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity being imported is not more than that specified in a research authorization certificate or research notification certificate, or, if the quantity is not so specified, the amount that is necessary to conduct the research.

Section.Text: A research establishment must return to the manufacturer any unused unregistered pest control products.

A research establishment must return to the manufacturer any unused registered pest control product unless it is kept by the research establishment to be used by a researcher or cooperator involved in the research in a way that is consistent with the directions on the approved label.

A research establishment may not distribute a pest control product that is used in the conduct of research to any person that is not a researcher or cooperator involved in the research, except in accordance with section 65 or 66.

When a research authorization certificate is issued, treated food and feed crops from research sites and meat (including meat by-products and fat), milk and eggs that may contain residues as a result of the research must not be sold unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: written authorization to do so is set out on the certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a chemical pest control product, residues do not exceed an amount that would result in the sale of the food being prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act.

Section.Text: In the case of research that meets the criteria set out in section 53 and for which a research notification certificate is issued,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a chemical pest control product, treated food and feed crops from research sites and meat (including meat by-products and fat), milk and eggs that may contain residues as a result of research must not be sold unless the residues do not exceed an amount that would result in the sale of the food being prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a microbial agent, other than one that contains Bacillus thuringiensis registered for use on agricultural crops, treated food and feed crops from research sites and meat (including meat by-products and fat), milk and eggs that may contain residues as a result of research must not be sold.

Section.Text: In the case of research that meets the criteria set out in subsection 55(2), treated food and feed crops from research sites and meat (including meat by-products and fat), milk and eggs that may contain residues as a result of research must not be sold unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a chemical pest control product, residues do not exceed an amount that would result in the sale of the food being prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of research that involves the use of a semiochemical, the research meets the criteria set out in subparagraph 55(2)(c)(viii).

Section.Text: A sample of a pest control product that is taken by an inspector under paragraph 48(1)(b) of the Act must be representative of the lot from which it is taken and may consist of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the entire package, in the case of a liquid packaged in containers of less than 5 L;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the entire package, in the case of a dry material packaged in containers of less than 5 kg; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the entire device, in the case of a device.

Section.Text: If a pest control product is seized under subsection 52(1) of the Act, the inspector must attach a detention tag to at least one package of the pest control product in the lot that is seized.
[Repeal]
These Regulations come into force on June 28, 2006.
Garment bags, cabinets or chests that are manufactured, represented or sold as a means to protect clothing or fabrics from pests.
Devices that are manufactured, represented or sold as a means to attract or destroy flying insects, or to attract and destroy them.
Devices that are manufactured, represented or sold as a means to repel pests by causing them physical discomfort by means of sound, touch or electromagnetic radiation.
Devices for attachment to garden watering hoses that are manufactured, represented or sold as a means to dispense or apply a pest control product.
Devices that are manufactured, represented or sold as a means to provide the automatic or unattended application of a pest control product.
Devices that are sold for use with chemical products that contain cyanide as a means to control animal pests.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 2
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Pest Control Products Exempt from Registration

Section.Text: Feed for animals, if the pest control product contained in the feed is registered under the Act for the purpose of mixing with feed.
A fertilizer that is subject to the Fertilizers Act, if the pest control product contained in it is registered under the Act.
Seed that has been treated with a pest control product that is registered for the purpose of treating such seed, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the seed is sold and shipped in bulk and the documents that accompany the shipment include the common chemical name of the active ingredient of the pest control product used to treat the seed or, if it has no common chemical name, its chemical or other name; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of seed that is packaged for distribution, the label shows the statement “This seed is treated with”, followed by the name of the pest control product, including the chemical name or common chemical name of its active ingredient, together with the appropriate precautionary symbols and signal words set out in Schedule 3 and any other applicable statements that are required by these Regulations.

Section.Text: A water conditioner that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is represented to control algae and is for use in or around homes in humidifiers, aquariums, waterbeds or any appliance that has a water reservoir;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains as its only active ingredient at most 60% copper sulphate registered under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is in a package whose label shows all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on the principal display panel,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the identity of the water conditioner in terms of its function referred to in paragraph (a),

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the information set out in items 1 to 3 of the table to section 6,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in the case of a water conditioner whose concentration of copper sulphate is set out in column 1 of item 2 or 3 of the table to this section, the precautionary symbol set out in column 2 of item 7 of Schedule 3, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the appropriate signal words set out in column 2 of the table to this section, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on the secondary display panel, the information set out in items 4 to 7 of the table to section 6.

row.entry: Concentration of Copper Sulphate in Water Conditioner
30% or more but not more than 60%

Section.Text: A device that is manufactured, represented or sold as a means to attract and destroy flying insects indoors, by means other than the use of an active ingredient that is a chemical, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the device is certified by the Canadian Standards Association as meeting the requirements of Standard CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 189-M89, entitled High-Voltage Insect Killers, as amended from time to time; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all of the following information appears on the label of the device:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the logo of the Canadian Standards Association,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identity of the device in terms of its function,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in items 3 to 6 of the table to section 6,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the precaution statement “This device should not be installed directly on or over surfaces where food is exposed, processed or prepared.”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement “To aid in the reduction of housefly population, use this device in conjunction with sanitary practices.”.

Section.Text: A device that is manufactured, represented or sold as a means to attract and destroy flying insects outdoors, by means other than the use of an active ingredient that is a chemical, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the device is certified by the Canadian Standards Association as meeting the requirements of Standard CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 189-M89, entitled High-Voltage Insect Killers, as amended from time to time; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all of the following information appears on the label of the device:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the logo of the Canadian Standards Association,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identity of the device in terms of its function,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information set out in items 3 to 6 of the table to this section,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement “For Outdoor Use Only.”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement “This device does not control blackflies, mosquitoes or other biting flies.”.

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the words “ACTIVE INGREDIENT:” or “ACTIVE INGREDIENTS:”, as the case may be;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the common chemical name of the active ingredient of the pest control product or, if it has no common chemical name, its chemical or other name; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: the concentration of the active ingredient, expressed, if the pest control product is

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a liquid, as a percentage by mass, or as mass per unit volume, or both, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a dust, wettable powder or other dry formulation, as a percentage by mass.
A declaration of net quantity of the pest control product in the package, expressed

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: by volume, if the pest control product is a liquid or gas or is viscous; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: by mass, if the pest control product is a solid or pressure-packed.
The name and postal address of the distributor.
The directions for the use of the pest control product, including application rates, timing of application and any limitations on its use.
Information that identifies any risks associated with the handling, storage, display, distribution and disposal of the pest control product, and instructions on procedures to reduce those risks.
Information that identifies any risks to health, the environment or anything in connection with which the pest control product is to be used, and instructions on procedures to reduce those risks.

Instructions in first aid, under the heading “FIRST AID INSTRUCTIONS”, that set out the practical measures to be taken in the event of poisoning, intoxication or injury caused by the pest control product.

Section.Text: A swimming pool product that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is represented or sold as a product whose function is to control bacteria or algae, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains as its only active ingredient a registered active ingredient of the type, concentration and percentage of available chlorine set out in the table to this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is in a package and whose label shows all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on the principal display panel,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the identity of the product in terms of its function referred to in paragraph (a),

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the information set out in items 1 to 3 of the table to section 6,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the appropriate signal words set out in column 4 of the table to this section,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: in the case of an active ingredient set out in column 1 of the table to this section, the precautionary symbol set out in column 5 of item 1 or of paragraph 2(b), 3(b), 4(b), 5(b) or 6(b) of that table, as applicable, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: in the case of an active ingredient set out in column 1 of any of items 2 to 6 of the table to this section, the precautionary symbol set out in column 5 of paragraph 2(a), 3(a), 4(a), 5(a) or 6(a) of that table, as applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on the secondary display panel, the information set out in items 4 to 7 of the table to section 6.

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol for warning - corrosive, consisting of a Diamond shape outline with bones of a hand inside.

Section.Text: A spa product that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is represented or sold as a product whose function is to control bacteria or algae, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains as its only active ingredient a registered active ingredient of the type, concentration and percentage of available chlorine set out in the table to this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is in a package and whose label shows all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on the principal display panel,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the identity of the product in terms of its function referred to in paragraph (a),

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the information set out in items 1 to 3 of the table to section 6,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the appropriate signal words set out in column 4 of the table to this section,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: in the case of an active ingredient set out in column 1 of any of items 1 to 3 and 5 of the table to this section, the precautionary symbol set out in column 5 of paragraph 1(b), 2(b) or 3(b) or item 5 of that table, as applicable, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: in the case of an active ingredient set out in column 1 of any of items 1 to 3 of the table to this section, the precautionary symbol set out in column 5 of paragraph 1(a), 2(a) or 3(a) of that table, as applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on the secondary display panel, the information set out in items 4 to 7 of the table to section 6.

table.title: Symbols, Signal Words and Hazard Statements from the Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling of Chemicals (GHS)

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of a flame with a thick black edge and the middle of the image, also in the shape of a flame, is white. This image rests above a horizontal black line of the same width as the black contour of the flame. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a flammability hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

The image of a long black gas cylinder with a short neck and that is leaning toward the right, almost horizontally. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a compressed gas hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: Contains gas under pressure; may explode if heated
Contains refrigerated gas; may cause cryogenic burns or injury

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Two images side by side. On the right side is a test tube pouring black droplets toward the right onto a hand whose fingers are directed toward the left, with the droplets causing damage at the point of contact. On the left side is another test tube pouring black droplets toward the left onto a black rectangle, with the droplets causing damage at the point of contact. Both images include four vertical wavy lines that radiate from the point of contact to symbolize smoke or fumes. The images of the test tubes have a black outline and white background and include the images of a black liquid near their pour points. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a corrosive hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of a black outline of a skull with a white background and black eyes and nose, over two crossed bones depicted by black outlines on white backgrounds. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of an acute toxicity hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.
The image of a large black exclamation mark. This symbol is used to warn about the presence of a health hazard. The image is set inside a red square set on a point.

row.entry: May cause an allergic skin reaction

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The image of an upright dead tree to the top left with an upside down dead fish to the bottom right. The fish is pointing head first upwards to the right. The image of the tree is black and the image of the fish is depicted in white with a black outline, both on a white background. Below the fish is a black triangular shape indicating water. The image is set inside a red square set on a point. The image is used to warn about environmental hazards.

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply to an application to register a pest control product or to amend a registration made on or after August 1, 2007 and before the day on which these Regulations come into force, if the applicant wishes to use or rely on compensable data of a registrant and the Minister has requested in writing that the parties negotiate the amount of compensation payable for that use or reliance.

Despite subsection (1), if the Minister’s request is made more than 60 days before the coming into force of these Regulations and the applicant sends a copy of an agreement to the registrant under subsection 17.8(2) of the Pest Control Products Regulations, as enacted by section 2, the 120-day period specified in subsection 17.9(2) of those Regulations, as enacted by section 2, is reduced to 60 days from the day after the agreement is sent.

Section.Text: Despite paragraph 17.5(3)(b) of the Pest Control Products Regulations, as enacted by section 2, the Minister must extend the exclusive use period established in accordance with section 17.5 of those Regulations, as enacted by section 2, if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there remain at least six months before the exclusive use period expires;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: minor uses are added to the registration on or after August 1, 2007 but before the day on which these Regulations come into force; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the registrant requests an extension of the exclusive use period within 30 days after the day on which these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II.

Subsection.Text: In this section, former Regulations means the Pest Control Products Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
The validity period of a conditional registration that is in effect before the coming into force of these Regulations continues to be in effect until the end of that period.

The validity period of a conditional registration that continues to be in effect after the coming into force of these Regulations may be extended under subsection 14(6) or (7) of the former Regulations.

Section.Text: The requirements in these Regulations respecting the information that must be shown on the label of a pest control product do not apply until the day on which the first of the following occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration of the pest control product, if it occurs on or after the day on which these Regulations come into force,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reprinting of the label,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the modification of the information on the label, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacture of the pest control product, if it occurs on or after the tenth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations come into force.

Section.Text: The definition common chemical name in subsection 1(1) of the Pest Control Products Regulations6 is amended by replacing “ISO 1750-1981 (E/F)” with “ISO 1750:1981 (E/F)”.
Subsection 24(1) of the Regulations is amended by replacing “Schedule A” with “Schedule A.1”.

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 26(3) of the English version of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:

Unless otherwise specified by the Minister under subsection 8(2) of the Act, if a pest control product is contained in more than one package, the outermost package that is visible under normal conditions of storage, transportation or handling must bear a label that shows all of the following information:
Paragraph 26(3)(b) of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: b)
Paragraph.Text: les renseignements exigés en vertu de l’alinéa (2)b), tels qu’ils figurent sur l’étiquette approuvée du produit, et qui sont pertinents s’il y a présence d’un risque important mentionné à cet alinéa, lorsque ce produit est contenu dans l’emballage extérieur;

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 26(4) of the French version of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:
Le paragraphe (3) ne s’applique pas si l’emballage extérieur est transparent ou s’il permet de lire l’étiquette sur l’emballage intérieur et que celle-ci satisfait aux exigences :

Section.Text: Paragraph 64(b) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity being imported is not more than that specified in a research authorization certificate or research notification certificate or that which is necessary to conduct the research for which a research establishment is exempt under section 55.
